102 
108 void SegmentationKernel::setSurface( const SurfUnstructured *surface, double featureAngle){
109 
110  m_surface = surface;
111  m_featureAngle = featureAngle;
112 
113  double tol = m_surface->getTol() ;
114 
115  m_segmentVertexNormals.setStaticKernel(&m_surface->getCells());
116 
117  std::vector<long> vertexNeighbours ;
118  std::vector<std::array<double,3>> limitedVertexNormals ;
119  for( SurfUnstructured::CellConstIterator segmentItr = m_surface->cellConstBegin(); segmentItr != m_surface->cellConstEnd(); ++segmentItr ){
120  long segmentId = segmentItr.getId() ;
121  std::size_t segmentRawId = segmentItr.getRawIndex() ;
122  const Cell &segment = *segmentItr;
123  ElementType segmentType = segment.getType() ;
124  int nSegmentVertices = segment.getVertexCount() ;
125  std::vector<std::array<double,3>> *segmentVertexNormals = m_segmentVertexNormals.rawData(segmentRawId);
126 
127  // Check if segment is supported
128  bool segmentSupported ;
129  switch (segmentType) {
130 
131  case ElementType::VERTEX :
132  case ElementType::LINE :
133  case ElementType::TRIANGLE :
134  segmentSupported = true ;
135  break ;
136 
137  default:
138  segmentSupported = false ;
139  break ;
140 
141  }
142 
143  if ( !segmentSupported ) {
144  throw std::runtime_error ("levelset: only segments and triangles supported in LevelSetSegmentation!") ;
145  }
146 
147  // Evaluate segment vertex normals
148  //
149  // Normals are initialized with unlimited normals, if the segment is
150  // misalign they will be replaced with limited normals.
151  (*segmentVertexNormals).resize(nSegmentVertices) ;
152  limitedVertexNormals.resize(nSegmentVertices) ;
153 
154  double misalignment = 0. ;
155  for( int i = 0; i < nSegmentVertices; ++i ){
156  vertexNeighbours.clear();
157  m_surface->findCellVertexNeighs(segmentId, i, &vertexNeighbours);
158 
159  (*segmentVertexNormals)[i] = m_surface->evalVertexNormal(segmentId, i, vertexNeighbours.size(), vertexNeighbours.data()) ;
160  limitedVertexNormals[i] = m_surface->evalLimitedVertexNormal(segmentId, i, vertexNeighbours.size(), vertexNeighbours.data(), m_featureAngle) ;
161 
162  misalignment += norm2((*segmentVertexNormals)[i] - limitedVertexNormals[i]) ;
163  }
164 
165  if( misalignment >= tol ){
166  segmentVertexNormals->swap(limitedVertexNormals);
167  }
168  }
169 
170  // Initialize search tree
171  m_searchTree = std::unique_ptr<SurfaceSkdTree>(new SurfaceSkdTree(surface));
172  m_searchTree->build();
173 }
174 
185 int SegmentationKernel::getSegmentInfo( const std::array<double,3> &pointCoords, long segmentId, bool signd, double &distance, std::array<double,3> &gradient, std::array<double,3> &normal ) const {
186 
187  SurfUnstructured::CellConstIterator segmentIterator = m_surface->getCellConstIterator(segmentId);
188  const Cell &segment = *segmentIterator ;
189  ElementType segmentType = segment.getType();
190  ConstProxyVector<long> segmentVertexIds = segment.getVertexIds() ;
191  int nSegmentVertices = segmentVertexIds.size() ;
192  const std::vector<std::array<double,3>> &segmentVertexNormals = m_segmentVertexNormals.rawAt(segmentIterator.getRawIndex());
193 
194  BITPIT_CREATE_WORKSPACE(lambda, double, nSegmentVertices, ReferenceElementInfo::MAX_ELEM_VERTICES);
195  std::array<double,3> projectionCoords;
196  switch (segmentType) {
197 
198  case ElementType::VERTEX :
199  {
200  long id = segmentVertexIds[0] ;
201  projectionCoords = m_surface->getVertexCoords(id);
202 
203  break;
204  }
205 
206  case ElementType::LINE:
207  {
208  long id0 = segmentVertexIds[0] ;
209  long id1 = segmentVertexIds[1] ;
210  projectionCoords = CGElem::projectPointSegment( pointCoords, m_surface->getVertexCoords(id0), m_surface->getVertexCoords(id1), lambda);
211 
212  break;
213  }
214 
215  case ElementType::TRIANGLE:
216  {
217  long id0 = segmentVertexIds[0] ;
218  long id1 = segmentVertexIds[1] ;
219  long id2 = segmentVertexIds[2] ;
220  projectionCoords = CGElem::projectPointTriangle( pointCoords, m_surface->getVertexCoords(id0), m_surface->getVertexCoords(id1), m_surface->getVertexCoords(id2), lambda );
221 
222  break;
223  }
224 
225  default:
226  {
227  std::runtime_error ("Type of cell not supported.");
228  break;
229  }
230 
231  }
232 
233  if (segmentType != ElementType::VERTEX) {
234  normal = lambda[0] * segmentVertexNormals[0] ;
235  for (int i = 1; i < nSegmentVertices; ++i) {
236  normal += lambda[i] * segmentVertexNormals[i] ;
237  }
238  normal /= norm2(normal) ;
239  } else {
240  normal.fill(0.);
241  }
242 
243  gradient = pointCoords-projectionCoords;
244  distance = norm2(gradient);
245  gradient /= distance;
246 
247  // the sign is computed by determining the side of point p
248  // with respect to the normal plane
249  int s = sign( dotProduct(gradient, normal) );
250 
251  // If the point lies on the normal plane (s = 0), but its distance is
252  // finite the sign must be evaluated considering the curvature of the
253  // surface. This is not implemented yet.
254  if(s==0 && distance>0){
255  distance = levelSetDefaults::VALUE;
256  gradient = levelSetDefaults::GRADIENT;
257  normal = levelSetDefaults::GRADIENT;
258 
259  return 1;
260  }
261 
262  // If signed distance are computed, the distance value and gradient
263  // need to be changed accordingly. If unsigned distance are computed
264  // the orientation of the suraface normal is discarded and in order
265  // to agnostic with repect the two sides of the surface
266  distance *= (double) ( signd *s + (!signd) *1);
267  gradient *= (double) ( signd *s + (!signd) *1);
268  normal *= (double) ( signd *1 + (!signd) *s);
269 
270  return 0;
271 }

373 int LevelSetSegmentation::getPart( long id ) const{
374 
375  long supportId = getSupport(id);
376 
377  if( supportId != levelSetDefaults::SUPPORT){
378  const SurfUnstructured &m_surface = m_segmentation->getSurface();
379  return m_surface.getCell(supportId).getPID();
380  } else {
381  return levelSetDefaults::PART ;
382  }
383 
384 }
385 
391 std::array<double,3> LevelSetSegmentation::getNormal( long id ) const{
392 
393  auto itr = m_surfaceInfo.find(id) ;
394  if( itr != m_surfaceInfo.end() ){
395  return itr->normal;
396  } else {
397  return levelSetDefaults::GRADIENT ;
398  }
399 
400 }
401 
402 
408 long LevelSetSegmentation::getSupport( long id ) const{
409 
410  auto itr = m_surfaceInfo.find(id) ;
411  if( itr != m_surfaceInfo.end() ){
412  return itr->support;
413  } else {
414  return levelSetDefaults::SUPPORT ;
415  }
416 
417 }
418 
424 double LevelSetSegmentation::getSurfaceFeatureSize( long i ) const {
425 
426  long support = getSupport(i);
427  if (support == levelSetDefaults::SUPPORT) {
428  return (- levelSetDefaults::SIZE);
429  }
430 
431  return getSegmentSize(support);
432 }
433 
439 double LevelSetSegmentation::getSegmentSize( long id ) const {
440 
441  const SurfUnstructured &m_surface = m_segmentation->getSurface();
442 
443  int spaceDimension = m_surface.getSpaceDimension();
444  if (spaceDimension == 2) {
445  return m_surface.evalCellArea(id); //TODO check
446  } else if (spaceDimension == 3) {
447  int dummy;
448  return m_surface.evalMinEdgeLength(id, dummy);
449  }
450 
451  return (- levelSetDefaults::SIZE);
452 }
453 
458 double LevelSetSegmentation::getMinSurfaceFeatureSize( ) const {
459 
460  const SurfUnstructured &m_surface = m_segmentation->getSurface();
461 
462  bool minimumValid = false;
463  double minimumSize = levelSetDefaults::SIZE;
464  for( const Cell &cell : m_surface.getCells() ){
465  double segmentSize = getSegmentSize(cell.getId());
466  if (segmentSize < 0) {
467  continue;
468  }
469 
470  minimumValid = true;
471  minimumSize = std::min(segmentSize, minimumSize);
472  }
473 
474  if (!minimumValid) {
475  minimumSize = - levelSetDefaults::SIZE;
476  }
477 
478  return minimumSize;
479 }
480 
485 double LevelSetSegmentation::getMaxSurfaceFeatureSize( ) const {
486 
487  const SurfUnstructured &m_surface = m_segmentation->getSurface();
488 
489  double maximumSize = - levelSetDefaults::SIZE;
490  for( const Cell &cell : m_surface.getCells() ){
491  double segmentSize = getSegmentSize(cell.getId());
492  maximumSize = std::max(segmentSize, maximumSize);
493  }
494 
495  return maximumSize;
496 }
497 
498 
506 bool LevelSetSegmentation::seedNarrowBand( LevelSetCartesian *visitee, std::vector<std::array<double,3>> &VS, double searchRadius, std::vector<long> &I){
507 
508  VolCartesian &mesh = *(static_cast<VolCartesian*>(visitee->getMesh()));
509 
510  bool found(false) ;
511  int dim( mesh.getDimension() ) ;
512  std::array<double,3> B0, B1;
513  std::vector<std::array<double,3>> VP ;
514 
515  mesh.getBoundingBox(B0, B1) ;
516 
517  for( int i=0; i<dim; ++i){
518  B0[i] -= searchRadius;
519  B1[i] += searchRadius;
520  }
521 
522  I.clear() ;
523 
524  for( const auto &P : VS){
525  if( CGElem::intersectPointBox( P, B0, B1, dim ) ) {
526  I.push_back( mesh.locateClosestCell(P) );
527  found = true ;
528  }
529  }
530 
531  if( !found && CGElem::intersectBoxPolygon( B0, B1, VS, false, true, true, VP, dim ) ) {
532  for( const auto &P : VP){
533  I.push_back( mesh.locateClosestCell(P) );
534  found = true ;
535  }
536  }
537 
538  return found ;
539 }
540 
546 void LevelSetSegmentation::getBoundingBox( std::array<double,3> &minP, std::array<double,3> &maxP ) const {
547  const SurfUnstructured &m_surface = m_segmentation->getSurface();
548  m_surface.getBoundingBox(minP,maxP) ;
549 }

554 void LevelSetSegmentation::__clear( ){

556  m_surfaceInfo.clear() ;
557 }

563 void LevelSetSegmentation::computeLSInNarrowBand(bool signd){
564 
565  log::cout() << "Computing levelset within the narrow band... " << std::endl;
566 
567  if( LevelSetCartesian* lsCartesian = dynamic_cast<LevelSetCartesian*>(m_kernelPtr) ){
568  computeLSInNarrowBand( lsCartesian, signd) ;
569 
570  } else if ( LevelSetOctree* lsOctree = dynamic_cast<LevelSetOctree*>(m_kernelPtr) ){
571  computeLSInNarrowBand( lsOctree, signd) ;
572 
573  }
574 }
575 
581 void LevelSetSegmentation::updateLSInNarrowBand( const std::vector<adaption::Info> &mapper, bool signd){
582 
583  log::cout() << "Updating levelset within the narrow band... " << std::endl;
584  if( LevelSetCartesian* lsCartesian= dynamic_cast<LevelSetCartesian*>(m_kernelPtr) ){
585 
586  // Update is not implemented for Cartesian patches
587  clear( ) ;
588  computeLSInNarrowBand( lsCartesian, signd) ;
589  return;
590  }
591 
592  if( LevelSetOctree* lsOctree = dynamic_cast<LevelSetOctree*>(m_kernelPtr) ){
593  updateLSInNarrowBand( lsOctree, mapper, signd ) ;
594  return;
595  }
596 
597 
598 }
599 
612 void LevelSetSegmentation::computeLSInNarrowBand( LevelSetCartesian *visitee, bool signd){
613 
614  VolCartesian &mesh = *(visitee->getCartesianMesh() ) ;
615  double searchRadius = m_narrowBand;
616 
617  if(searchRadius<0.){
618  for( int d=0; d < mesh.getDimension(); ++d){
619  searchRadius = std::max( searchRadius, mesh.getSpacing(d) ) ;
620  }
621  }
622 
623  std::vector<std::array<double,3>> VS;
624 
625  const SurfUnstructured &m_surface = m_segmentation->getSurface();
626 
627  std::vector<long> stack, temp, neighs, flag( mesh.getCellCount(), -1);
628 
629  std::vector< std::array<double,3> > cloud ;
630  std::vector<double> cloudDistance;
631 
632  double distance;
633  std::array<double,3> gradient, normal;
634 
635  stack.reserve(128) ;
636  temp.reserve(128) ;
637 
638  log::cout() << " Compute levelset on cartesian mesh" << std::endl;
639 
640  for (const Cell &segment : m_surface.getCells()) {
641  // get segment info
642  long segmentId = segment.getId();
643  ElementType segmentType = segment.getType();
644  ConstProxyVector<long> segmentVertexIds = segment.getVertexIds();
645  std::size_t nSegmentVertices = segmentVertexIds.size();
646 
647  // get segment coordinates
648  VS.resize(nSegmentVertices);
649  m_surface.getVertexCoords(nSegmentVertices, segmentVertexIds.data(), VS.data());
650 
651  // compute initial seeds, ie the cells where the vertices
652  // of the surface element fall in and add them to stack
653  seedNarrowBand( visitee, VS, searchRadius, stack );
654 
655  // propagate from seed
656  size_t stackSize = stack.size();
657  while (stackSize > 0) {
658 
659  // put the cell centroids of the stack into a vector
660  // and calculate the distances to the cloud
661  cloud.resize(stackSize) ;
662  cloudDistance.resize(stackSize);
663 
664  for( size_t k = 0; k < stackSize; ++k) {
665  long cell = stack[k];
666  cloud[k] = visitee->computeCellCentroid(cell) ;
667  }
668 
669  switch (segmentType) {
670 
671  case ElementType::VERTEX :
672  {
673  for( size_t k=0; k<stackSize; ++k){
674  cloudDistance[k] = norm2( cloud[k]-VS[0]);
675  }
676  break;
677  }
678 
679  case ElementType::LINE:
680  {
681  for( size_t k=0; k<stackSize; ++k){
682  cloudDistance[k] = CGElem::distancePointSegment( cloud[k], VS[0], VS[1]);
683  }
684  break;
685  }
686 
687  case ElementType::TRIANGLE:
688  {
689  cloudDistance = CGElem::distanceCloudTriangle( cloud, VS[0], VS[1], VS[2]);
690  break;
691  }
692 
693  default:
694  {
695  std::runtime_error ("Type of cell not supported.");
696  break;
697  }
698  }
699 
700  // check each cell of cloud individually
701  for( size_t k = 0; k < stackSize; ++k) {
702 
703  long &cellId = stack[k];
704  double &cellDistance = cloudDistance[k];
705 
706  // consider only cells within the search radius
707  if ( cellDistance <= searchRadius ) {
708 
709  PiercedVector<LevelSetInfo>::iterator lsInfoItr = m_ls.find(cellId) ;
710  if( lsInfoItr == m_ls.end() ){
711  lsInfoItr = m_ls.emplace(cellId) ;
712  }
713 
714  // check if the computed distance is the closest distance
715  if( cellDistance < std::abs(lsInfoItr->value) ){
716 
717  // compute all necessary information and store them
718  //
719  // If an error occures, there should exists another
720  // segment from which the levelset information can
721  // be extracted from.
722  int error = m_segmentation->getSegmentInfo(cloud[k], segmentId, signd, distance, gradient, normal);
723  if (!error) {
724  lsInfoItr->value = distance;
725  lsInfoItr->gradient = gradient;
726 
727  auto infoItr = m_surfaceInfo.find(cellId) ;
728  if( infoItr == m_surfaceInfo.end() ){
729  infoItr = m_surfaceInfo.emplace(cellId) ;
730  }
731  infoItr->support = segmentId;
732  infoItr->normal = normal;
733  }
734  }
735 
736 
737  // the new stack is composed of all neighbours
738  // of the old stack. Attention must be paid in
739  // order not to evaluate the same cell twice
740  neighs.clear();
741  mesh.findCellFaceNeighs(cellId, &neighs) ;
742  for( const auto & neigh : neighs){
743  if( flag[neigh] != segmentId) {
744  temp.push_back( neigh) ;
745  flag[neigh] = segmentId ;
746  }
747  }
748 
749  } //end if distance
750  }
751 
752  stack.clear() ;
753  stack.swap( temp ) ;
754  stackSize = stack.size() ;
755 
756  } //end while
757  }
758 }
759 
772 void LevelSetSegmentation::computeLSInNarrowBand( LevelSetOctree *visitee, bool signd){
773 
774  VolumeKernel &mesh = *(visitee->getMesh()) ;
775 
776  double intersectionFactor = 0.5 * std::sqrt((double) mesh.getDimension());
777 
778  std::unordered_set<long> intersectedCells;
779 
780  // Evaluate levelset information
781  for( const Cell &cell : mesh.getCells() ){
782 
783  // Identify the segment associated with the cell
784  //
785  // The search radius is evaluated as the maximum value between the
786  // narroband size and the distance above which the cell will surely
787  // not intersect the surface. In this way, cells that intersect the
788  // surface are always included in the narrowband, even if their
789  // distance from the surface is greater than then narrowband size
790  // explicitly set by the user.
791  //
792  // If no segment is identified the cell is not processed.
793  long cellId = cell.getId();
794  std::array<double,3> cellCentroid = visitee->computeCellCentroid(cellId);
795 
796  double intersectDistance = intersectionFactor * mesh.evalCellSize(cellId);
797  double searchRadius = std::max(m_narrowBand, intersectDistance);
798 
799  long segmentId;
800  double distance;
801  m_segmentation->getSearchTree().findPointClosestCell(cellCentroid, searchRadius, &segmentId, &distance);
802  if(segmentId < 0){
803  continue;
804  }
805 
806  // Evaluate levelset information
807  std::array<double,3> gradient;
808  std::array<double,3> normal;
809  int error = m_segmentation->getSegmentInfo(cellCentroid, segmentId, signd, distance, gradient, normal);
810  if (error) {
811  throw std::runtime_error ("Unable to extract the levelset information from segment.");
812  }
813 
814  PiercedVector<LevelSetInfo>::iterator lsInfoItr = m_ls.find(cellId);
815  lsInfoItr = m_ls.emplace(cellId) ;
816  lsInfoItr->value = distance;
817  lsInfoItr->gradient = gradient;
818 
819  PiercedVector<SurfaceInfo>::iterator infoItr = m_surfaceInfo.emplace(cellId);
820  infoItr->support = segmentId;
821  infoItr->normal = normal;
822 
823  // Update the list of cells that intersects the surface
824  //
825  // When the narrowband size is not explicitly set, the cell will always
826  // intersects the surface because only cells that intersect the surface
827  // are considered, otherwise we need to check if the absolute distance
828  // associated with the cell is lower than the intersection distance.
829  if (m_narrowBand < 0 || intersectDistance < std::abs(lsInfoItr->value)) {
830  intersectedCells.insert(cellId);
831  }
832 
833  }
834 
835  // Process the neighbours of the cells that intersect the surface
836  //
837  // If a cell intersects the surface, we need to evaluate the levelset
838  // of all its neigbours.
839  for( long cellId : intersectedCells){
840 
841  Cell const &cell = mesh.getCell(cellId);
842 
843  std::array<double,3> cellProjectionPoint = computeProjectionPoint(cellId);
844 
845  const long *neighbours = cell.getAdjacencies() ;
846  int nNeighbours = cell.getAdjacencyCount() ;
847  for (int n = 0; n < nNeighbours; ++n) {
848  // Skip the neighbour if it has already been processed
849  //
850  // The neighbour may already have been processed either because
851  // it distance from the segmentation is within the search radius,
852  // or because is a neighbour of an intersected cells already
853  // processed.
854  long neighId = neighbours[n];
855  if( m_ls.count(neighId) != 0 ){
856  continue;
857  }
858 
859  // Identify the segment associated with the neighbour
860  std::array<double,3> neighCentroid = visitee->computeCellCentroid(neighId);
861 
862  double searchRadius = 1.05 * norm2(neighCentroid - cellProjectionPoint);
863 
864  long segmentId;
865  double distance;
866  m_segmentation->getSearchTree().findPointClosestCell(neighCentroid, searchRadius, &segmentId, &distance);
867  if (segmentId < 0) {
868  assert(false && "Should not pass here");
869  }
870 
871  // Evaluate negihbour leveset information
872  std::array<double,3> gradient;
873  std::array<double,3> normal;
874  int error = m_segmentation->getSegmentInfo(neighCentroid, segmentId, signd, distance, gradient, normal);
875  if (error) {
876  throw std::runtime_error ("Unable to extract the levelset information from segment.");
877  }
878 
879  PiercedVector<LevelSetInfo>::iterator lsInfoItr = m_ls.emplace(neighId) ;
880  lsInfoItr->value = distance;
881  lsInfoItr->gradient = gradient;
882 
883  PiercedVector<SurfaceInfo>::iterator infoItr = m_surfaceInfo.emplace(neighId);
884  infoItr->support = segmentId;
885  infoItr->normal = normal;
886  }
887  }
888 }
889 
903 void LevelSetSegmentation::updateLSInNarrowBand( LevelSetOctree *visitee, const std::vector<adaption::Info> &mapper, bool signd){
904 
905  VolumeKernel &mesh = *(visitee->getMesh()) ;
906 
907  double intersectionFactor = 0.5 * std::sqrt((double) mesh.getDimension());
908 
909  std::vector<long> cellsOutsideNarrowband;
910 
911  // Evaluate the levelset of the cells
912  //
913  // When searching for the segment associated to a cell, the search radius
914  // is evaluated as the maximum value between the narroband size and the
915  // distance above which the cell will surely not intersect the surface.
916  for( const auto &event : mapper ){
917 
918  if( event.entity != adaption::Entity::ENTITY_CELL ){
919  continue;
920  }
921 
922  for( long cellId : event.current ){
923 
924  // Identify the segment associated with the cell
925  //
926  // The search radius is evaluated as the maximum value between the
927  // narroband size and the distance above which the cell will surely
928  // not intersect the surface. In this way, cells that intersect the
929  // surface are always included in the narrowband, even if their
930  // distance from the surface is greater than then narrowband size
931  // explicitly set by the user.
932  //
933  // If no segment is identified the cell is not processed.
934  std::array<double,3> centroid = visitee->computeCellCentroid(cellId);
935 
936  double intersectDistance = intersectionFactor * mesh.evalCellSize(cellId);
937  double searchRadius = std::max(m_narrowBand, intersectDistance);
938 
939  long segmentId;
940  double distance;
941  m_segmentation->getSearchTree().findPointClosestCell(centroid, searchRadius, &segmentId, &distance);
942  if (segmentId < 0) {
943  cellsOutsideNarrowband.push_back(cellId);
944  continue;
945  }
946 
947  // Evaluate levelset information
948  std::array<double,3> gradient;
949  std::array<double,3> normal;
950  int error = m_segmentation->getSegmentInfo(centroid, segmentId, signd, distance, gradient, normal);
951  if (error) {
952  throw std::runtime_error ("Unable to extract the levelset information from segment.");
953  }
954 
955  PiercedVector<LevelSetInfo>::iterator lsInfoItr = m_ls.emplace(cellId) ;
956  lsInfoItr->value = distance;
957  lsInfoItr->gradient = gradient;
958 
959  PiercedVector<SurfaceInfo>::iterator infoItr = m_surfaceInfo.emplace(cellId) ;
960  infoItr->support = segmentId;
961  infoItr->normal = normal;
962  }
963 
964  }
965 
966  // Cells with neighbours that intersect the surface need to be added to
967  // the narrowband even if they don't intersect the surface themself or
968  // have a distance from the surface greater than the narroband size.
969  for( long cellId : cellsOutsideNarrowband){
970  const Cell &cell = mesh.getCell(cellId);
971 
972  // Consider only cells with a neighbour that intersects the surface
973  const long *neighbours = cell.getAdjacencies() ;
974  int nNeighbours = cell.getAdjacencyCount() ;
975 
976  long intersectedNeighId = Cell::NULL_ID;
977  for (int n = 0; n < nNeighbours; ++n) {
978  long neighId = neighbours[n];
979  if( intersectSurface(neighId,LevelSetIntersectionMode::FAST_GUARANTEE_FALSE) == LevelSetIntersectionStatus::TRUE){
980  intersectedNeighId = neighId;
981  break;
982  }
983  }
984 
985  if (intersectedNeighId == Cell::NULL_ID) {
986  continue;
987  }
988 
989  // Identify the segment associated with the cell
990  std::array<double,3> cellCentroid = visitee->computeCellCentroid(cellId);
991  std::array<double,3> neighProjectionPoint = computeProjectionPoint(intersectedNeighId);
992 
993  double searchRadius = 1.05 * norm2(cellCentroid - neighProjectionPoint);
994 
995  long segmentId;
996  double distance;
997  m_segmentation->getSearchTree().findPointClosestCell(cellCentroid, searchRadius, &segmentId, &distance);
998  if (segmentId < 0) {
999  assert(false && "Should not pass here");
1000  continue;
1001  }
1002 
1003  // Evaluate levelset information for the cell
1004  std::array<double,3> gradient;
1005  std::array<double,3> normal;
1006  int error = m_segmentation->getSegmentInfo(cellCentroid, segmentId, signd, distance, gradient, normal);
1007  if (error) {
1008  throw std::runtime_error ("Unable to extract the levelset information from segment.");
1009  }
1010 
1011  PiercedVector<LevelSetInfo>::iterator lsInfoItr = m_ls.emplace(cellId) ;
1012  lsInfoItr->value = distance;
1013  lsInfoItr->gradient = gradient;
1014 
1015  PiercedVector<SurfaceInfo>::iterator infoItr = m_surfaceInfo.emplace(cellId);
1016  infoItr->support = segmentId;
1017  infoItr->normal = normal;
1018  }
1019 }
1020 
1026 void LevelSetSegmentation::__clearAfterMeshAdaption( const std::vector<adaption::Info> &mapper ){
1027 
1028  for ( const auto &info : mapper ){
1029  // Consider only changes on cells
1030  if( info.entity != adaption::Entity::ENTITY_CELL ){
1031  continue;
1032  }
1033 
1034  // Delete only old data that belongs to the current process
1035  if (info.type == adaption::Type::TYPE_PARTITION_RECV) {
1036  continue;
1037  }
1038 
1039  // Remove info of previous cells
1040  for ( long parent : info.previous ) {
1041  if ( m_surfaceInfo.find( parent ) != m_surfaceInfo.end() ) {
1042  m_surfaceInfo.erase( parent, true ) ;
1043  }
1044  }
1045  }
1046 
1047  m_surfaceInfo.flush();
1048 }
1049 
1054 void LevelSetSegmentation::__dump( std::ostream &stream ){
1055 
1056  utils::binary::write( stream, m_surfaceInfo.size() ) ;
1057 
1058  bitpit::PiercedVector<SurfaceInfo>::iterator infoItr, infoEnd = m_surfaceInfo.end() ;
1059  for( infoItr = m_surfaceInfo.begin(); infoItr != infoEnd; ++infoItr){
1060  utils::binary::write( stream, infoItr.getId() );
1061  utils::binary::write( stream, infoItr->support );
1062  utils::binary::write( stream, infoItr->normal );
1063  }
1064 }
1065 
1070 void LevelSetSegmentation::__restore( std::istream &stream ){
1071 
1072  size_t size;
1073 
1074  long id;
1075  long support;
1076  std::array<double,3> normal;
1077 
1078  utils::binary::read( stream, size ) ;
1079  m_surfaceInfo.reserve(size);
1080 
1081  for( size_t i=0; i<size; ++i){
1082  utils::binary::read( stream, id );
1083 
1084  utils::binary::read( stream, support );
1085  utils::binary::read( stream, normal );
1086 
1087  m_surfaceInfo.insert(id, SurfaceInfo(support,normal));
1088  }
1089 }
1090 
1091 # if BITPIT_ENABLE_MPI
1092 
1098 void LevelSetSegmentation::__writeCommunicationBuffer( const std::vector<long> &sendList, SendBuffer &dataBuffer ){
1099 
1100  // Evaluate the size of the buffer
1101  long nItems = 0;
1102  for( const auto &index : sendList){
1103  auto infoItr = m_surfaceInfo.find(index) ;
1104  if( infoItr != m_surfaceInfo.end() ){
1105  nItems++ ;
1106  }
1107  }
1108 
1109  dataBuffer.setSize(dataBuffer.getSize() + sizeof(long) + nItems* ( 2*sizeof(long) +3*sizeof(double) ));
1110 
1111  // Fill the buffer
1112  dataBuffer << nItems ;
1113 
1114  long index = 0 ;
1115  for( long id : sendList){
1116  auto infoItr = m_surfaceInfo.find(id) ;
1117  if( infoItr != m_surfaceInfo.end() ){
1118  dataBuffer << index ;
1119  dataBuffer << infoItr->support;
1120  dataBuffer << infoItr->normal;
1121  }
1122 
1123  ++index;
1124  }
1125 }
1126 
1132 void LevelSetSegmentation::__readCommunicationBuffer( const std::vector<long> &recvList, RecvBuffer &dataBuffer ){
1133 
1134  long nItems ;
1135  dataBuffer >> nItems ;
1136 
1137  for( long i=0; i<nItems; ++i){
1138  // Get the id of the element
1139  long index;
1140  dataBuffer >> index;
1141  long id = recvList[index] ;
1142 
1143  // Assign the data of the element
1144  auto infoItr = m_surfaceInfo.find(id) ;
1145  if( infoItr == m_surfaceInfo.end() ){
1146  infoItr = m_surfaceInfo.emplace(id) ;
1147  }
1148  dataBuffer >> infoItr->support;
1149  dataBuffer >> infoItr->normal;
1150  }
1151 }
1152 # endif
1153 
1159 LevelSetInfo LevelSetSegmentation::computeLevelSetInfo(const std::array<double,3> &coords) const {
1160 
1161  long segmentId;
1162  double distance;
1163  std::array<double,3> gradient;
1164  std::array<double,3> normal;
1165 
1166  m_segmentation->getSearchTree().findPointClosestCell(coords, &segmentId, &distance);
1167 
1168  int error = m_segmentation->getSegmentInfo(coords, segmentId, false, distance, gradient, normal);
1169  if (error) {
1170  throw std::runtime_error ("Unable to extract the levelset information from segment.");
1171  }
1172 
1173  return LevelSetInfo(distance,gradient);
1174 
1175 }
1176
